channel.title: Pokemon Blue or Red?
channel.description:
I pick blue! Just because it was my first ever gameboy game.
Also I'm not including gold/yellow/leaf green because they don't compare!
[img]http://www.rgame.nl/pokeblue_gb.JPG[/img]

item.title: Pokemon Blue or Red?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Still have my blue, first video game I properly got into, I think I’ve racked up about 100 hours on my one and only game on that beast.

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Blue or Red?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:31, topic:261515”][quote author=sppt link=topic=345329.msg2664832#msg2664832 date=1234477446]

the missingno bug worked on red too im pretty sure.

Yeah, but not my red cartridge!
[/quote]
worked on mine, mebe urs sucks

red candy bug was epic also.[/quote]
The red candy bug?
Don’t you mean rare candy?

Also, I believe that blue cartridge was the US version of pokemon whereas the red cartridge was a EU cartridge which afaik had been fixed in the meantime.

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Blue or Red?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“pureman222, post:27, topic:261515”]i played all the pokemons until 2009 until now i play online and from 6 years old im playing it since 1995i played pokemons blue,red,yellow,crystal,gold,pearl,black,diamond at last i just got dialga and palkia u can ask me any question i know allll the npcs hits as tackle and 99% i know all npc names and from what kind like water,fire…and i know all hits+names+newest versions+i got actionreplay

any quesiton for pokemon ask me im ready for help lastest kind of pokemon is pokemon pearl & diamond anyone want join in ds pm me[/quote]

You’re an idiot. No one cares about how much you know, if we ever even wanted to know the names of all the Pokemon, we could just search on Google to find a list of all of the Pokemon. Which would most likely include a full dossier on each Pokemon. No one gives a shit if you have an Action Replay, ‘Wow you have all the Pokemon in the game because you cheated, good for you!’.

Another thing, Diamond and Pearl are not the latest Pokemon games for the DS. So obviously you don’t know all about Pokemon. If you were such an expert on Pokemon you would actually know there is no Pokemon Black/Onyx. The only thing remotely close to a Pokemon Black would be Pokemon Trading Card Game.

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Blue or Red?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:19, topic:261515”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=345329.msg2663089#msg2663089 date=1234336961]
but blue was exactly the same as red was it not? i didn’t notice any differences when i played friends red’s.
[/quote]

Yes they were the same, the differences that I know of was that they contained some different pokemon. So if you wanted to get all of the pokemon, and you owned red, you would need to trade pokemon with someone else who has pokemon blue.

Same with silver/gold etc.[/quote]

That and the color of the game was different. Like the screen was red for red, blue for blue, and yellow for yellow. I think I remember it being that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Blue or Red?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

xEnt:

but blue was exactly the same as red was it not? i didn’t notice any differences when i played friends red’s.

Yes they were the same, the differences that I know of was that they contained some different pokemon. So if you wanted to get all of the pokemon, and you owned red, you would need to trade pokemon with someone else who has pokemon blue.

Same with silver/gold etc.
